discussion.p: Because the destructor of the std::future returned from the std::async blocks until the asynchronous operation completes, discarding the std::async return value leads to the synchronous code execution, which is pointless. For example, in the following code
task1 and task2 will be concurrently executed in the function 'foo', but sequentially in the function 'bar'.
This should be handled by Nico's paper P0600.

resolution.p: Resolved by adoption of P0600 in Albuquerque
